alert.note: Alert for Harris; Meriwether; Talbot (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 11:29AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Meriwether, northwestern Talbot and Harris Counties through NOON EDT... At 1129 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Pine Mountain to near Hamilton to near Lake Harding, and moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Manchester, Pine Mountain, Warm Springs, F.d. Roosevelt State Park, Mountain Hill, Flint Hill, Mulberry Grove, Lake Harding, Cataula and Goat Rock Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
